intro: Eremostachys adenantha, commonly known as the desert bellflower, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and hairy stems that help reduce water loss in harsh environments. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming during the summer months. Its leaves are narrow and grayish-green, adapted to minimize transpiration. Eremostachys adenantha is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to drought conditions.
